Articles.Content:
So basically you just tell about what was your first post,what was it about and why you created your account

My first post was on the Planet cyran thread telling about a problem with the clouds on the planets in the game. 

I created my account to write that comment because I noticed none of the bugs I found were being mentioned.
The first post was for the same reason I created the account : to thanks CaptRobau for its Outer Planets Mods under 1.0.2.

My first post was lost in the Great Forum Crash.  I have no idea what it was.

I created my account to be able to post on the forum.

Started playing 3 1/2 yrs ago with version 0.23. Joined the forum 2 yrs ago to post because the change in aero between 0.90 and 1.0.4 left me baffled as to why I could not reenter Kerbin atmosphere without overheating and exploding. That was a tough relearning time. Everything I thought I knew was wrong but the experts here helped me through it.
Uh... I have no clue. Thousands of posts does that to a person...

Oh 

I remember 

I asked for help to get to the Duna.

I wanted to be the first to do something on the internet. I succeeded with a Jool-5 ISRU run.

Then I made a Rubik's Cube.
I made my account for no particular reason other than to get involved in the community. My first post was helping someone out in Gameplay Questions...

I started playing about 2 years ago, but I never got an account until January. The reason I got one was to be able to get involved in the "What Did You Do In KSP Today?" thread. I had been browsing it for many months previously, interested in the cool and unique posts there, and one day decided that I could start posting too.

My first post detailed an Interstellar-like momment early in my first career save, when my tourist spacecraft started spinning wildly out of control while Jeb was out on EVA, attempting a manual crew transfer. In a momment of absent-mindedness, I had forgot that I could just transfer him through the ship!
